net.proteusframework.ui.column

Class DataColumnTableModel<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTableModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.column.BaseDataColumnTableModel<V>
        • net.proteusframework.ui.column.DataColumnTableModel<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the row type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableModel

    public class DataColumnTableModel<V>
extends BaseDataColumnTableModel<V>
    TableModel that defines it's columns with the TableDataColumn interface.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    TableDataColumn

      • bottom

        public void bottom(int rowIndex)
        Move the item at the specified index to the top of the list. If the index is invalid or the item is already at the end of the list, the method returns without making any changes to the order.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index to affect.

      • changeOrder

        public void changeOrder(int rowIndex,
               int destination)
        Move the specified rowIndex before specified destination in the model's list.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the rowIndex to move.
        destination - the destination index.

      • clearAllRows

        public void clearAllRows()
        Clear all rows.

      • down

        public void down(int rowIndex)
        Move the item at the specified index down in the list. If the index is invalid or the item is already at the end of the list, the method returns without making any changes to the order.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index to affect.

      • getRowIndex

        public int getRowIndex(V row)
        Get the row index.
        Parameters:
        row - the row.
        Returns:
        the index or -1.

      • getRows

        public List<V> getRows()
        Get the rows. This method returns a new list. The entities are attached unless BaseDataColumnTableModel.setAutoReattachEntities(boolean) is called with false.
        Returns:
        the rows.

        destination - the destination index.

      • replaceRow

        public void replaceRow(V currentRow,
              V newRow)
        Replace a row. If resorting is desired, call the setOrderedColumn method.
        Parameters:
        currentRow - current row.
        newRow - new row.

      • setRows

        public void setRows(Collection<? extends V> rows)
        Set the rows in the model.
        Parameters:
        rows - the rows.

      • top

        public void top(int rowIndex)
        Move the item at the specified index to the top of the list. If the index is invalid or the item is already at the end of the list, the method returns without making any changes to the order.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index to affect.

      • up

        public void up(int rowIndex)
        Move the item at the specified index up in the list. If the index is invalid or the item is already at the beginning of the list, the method returns without making any changes to the order.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index to affect.
